xxl.core.relational.metaData
Class ResultSetMetaDatas

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.metaData.ResultSetMetaDatas

public class ResultSetMetaDatas
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides static methods for dealing with instances implementing the interface result set metadata. Beside this methods, it contains constants for identifying columns storing data that is rather important for query processing and optimization.

See Also:
ResultSetMetaData

Field Detail

RESULTSET_METADATA_COMPARATOR

public static final java.util.Comparator<java.sql.ResultSetMetaData> RESULTSET_METADATA_COMPARATOR
This constant provides a comparator for relational metadata (result set metadata). The given relational metadata is compared for the number of columns, the column names, the column types and a possible loss of precision.

RESULTSET_METADATA_CONVERTER

public static final Converter<java.sql.ResultSetMetaData> RESULTSET_METADATA_CONVERTER
This constant provides a converter for relational metadata (result set metadata). All information of a given relational metadata is serialized to the specified output steam. The converter creates stored column metadata objects and puts them together to a result set metadata object.

RESULTSET_METADATA_HASH_FUNCTION

public static final Function<java.sql.ResultSetMetaData,java.lang.Integer> RESULTSET_METADATA_HASH_FUNCTION
This constant provides a hash function for relational metadata (result set metadata). The hash-code of a given relational metadata is defined as the sum of number of columns, the hash-codes of the column names, the column types and a the precision.

TIME_INTERVAL_START_TIMESTAMP

public static final java.lang.String TIME_INTERVAL_START_TIMESTAMP
This constant can be used to indicate that a column of the described result set stores the start timestamp of the tuple's time interval.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TIME_INTERVAL_END_TIMESTAMP

public static final java.lang.String TIME_INTERVAL_END_TIMESTAMP
This constant can be used to indicate that a column of the described result set stores the end timestamp of the tuple's time interval.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RESULTSET_METADATA_TYPE

public static final java.lang.String RESULTSET_METADATA_TYPE
This constant can be used to identify relational metadata inside a composite metadata.

See Also:

Method Detail

getResultSetMetaData

public static java.sql.ResultSetMetaData getResultSetMetaData(MetaDataProvider<? extends CompositeMetaData<? super java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object>> metaDataProvider)
                                                       throws MetaDataException
Returns the metadata fragment of the given metadata provider's metadata representing its relational metadata.

Parameters:
metaDataProvider - the metadata provider containing the desired relational metadata fragment.
Returns:
the relational metadata fragment of the given metadata provider's metadata.
Throws:
MetaDataException - when the given metadata provider's metadata does not contain any relational metadata fragment.

hasUniqueColumnNames

public static boolean hasUniqueColumnNames(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData resultSetMetaData)
                                    throws MetaDataException
Tests whether the columns of the the specified relational metadata have unique names.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that's column names should be tested for uniqueness.
Returns:
true, if all columns of the specified relational metadata have unique names, otherwise false.
Throws:
MetaDataException - when the column names of the specified relational metadata cannot be accessed.

getColumnIndex

public static int getColumnIndex(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData resultSetMetaData,
                                 java.lang.String columnName)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Resolves the number of the column with the specified name in the given relational metadata. When no column name matches the given name (ignoring its case) 0 is returned. When multiple columns matches the given column name (ignoring its case) -1 is returned.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that is searched for the given column name.
columnName - the column name which column number in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
Returns:
the number of the column with the specified name in the given relational metadata.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getColumnIndices

public static int[] getColumnIndices(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData resultSetMetaData,
                                     java.lang.String[] columnNames)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
Transfers an array of column names into an array of indices. For every column, a partner is searched in the result set's metadata. When no column name matches the given name (ignoring its case) 0 is inserted into the array to be returned.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that is searched for the given column names.
columnNames - an array of strings that contains the names of some of the result set's columns.
Returns:
an array of int values containing the indices of the given columns.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getColumnIndex

public static int getColumnIndex(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData resultSetMetaData,
                                 java.lang.String tableName,
                                 java.lang.String columnName)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Resolves the number of the column with the specified table and column name in the given relational metadata. When no column matches the given names (ignoring its case) 0 is returned. When multiple columns matches the given names (ignoring its case) -1 is returned.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that is searched for the given column name.
tableName - the table name of the column whose column number in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
columnName - the name of the column whose column number in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
Returns:
the number of the column with the specified table and column name in the given relational metadata.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

                                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Resolves the indices of the columns with the specified table name in the given relational metadata.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that is searched for columns matching the given table name.
tableName - the table name of the columns thats indices in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
Returns:
the indices of the columns with the specified table name in the given relational metadata.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getColumnIndex

public static int getColumnIndex(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData resultSetMetaData,
                                 java.lang.String schemaName,
                                 java.lang.String tableName,
                                 java.lang.String columnName)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Resolves the number of the column with the specified schema, table and column name in the given relational metadata. When no column matches the given names (ignoring its case) 0 is returned.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that is searched for the given column name.
schemaName - the schema name of the column whose column number in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
tableName - the table name of the column whose column number in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
columnName - the name of the column whose column number in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
Returns:
the number of the column with the specified schema, table and column name in the given relational metadata.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

                                                                 java.lang.String schemaName,
                                                                 java.lang.String tableName)
                                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Resolves the indices of the columns with the specified schema and table name in the given relational metadata.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that is searched for columns matching the given schema and table name.
schemaName - the schema name of the columns thats indices in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
tableName - the table name of the columns thats indices in the given relational metadata should be resolved.
Returns:
the indices of the columns with the specified schema and table name in the given relational metadata.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getColumnNames

public static java.lang.String[] getColumnNames(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData resultSetMetaData,
                                                int... columnIndices)
                                         throws java.sql.SQLException
/** Transfers an array of indices into an array of column names. To get the column names, this method uses a result set 's metadata that is passed to the method call.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that is searched for the given column indices.
columnIndices - an array of int values that contains indices of some of the result set's columns.
Returns:
an array of string objects containing the names of the given columns.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs.

getStringColumns

public static int[] getStringColumns(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData resultSetMetaData)
Get the columns numbers of strings in a metadata object.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata that is searched for string columns.
Returns:
a new array of the appropriate length.
